name: TheAtlantic
text: "The inability to compromise at home is becoming the modus operandi overseas. In the past, a sense of common domestic purpose gave ballast to U.S. diplomacy; now its absence enfeebles it," William J. Burns writes. https://t.co/nJe8MZLfI7

name: TheAtlantic
text: Amid a global pandemic and growing civil unrest, Los Angeles finally gave the green light for drive-in theaters to reopen. But going to one felt far from normal, @shirklesxp reports: https://t.co/pgcdr3Lb2j

name: TheAtlantic
text: When people pass into myth, they lose dimension; the hard-earned lessons of their life are flattened into platitudes. Few people earned their lessons harder than Larry Kramer had to. @mthomps remembers his 2018 visit with the late AIDS activist: https://t.co/QtSYXrW89m

name: TheAtlantic
text: Listen: Would defunding the police make us safer? @avitale joins @jameshamblin and @katlwells to discuss on the latest "Social Distance" podcast. https://t.co/AadXZjMshB

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @yayitsrob: Yes, the protests and the police response will exacerbate the pandemic.

But cases may have already been rising. Arizona, North Carolina, and California are seeing more cases than ever. The US is now trying to do harm reduction around Covid, not beat it: 
https://t.co/BJFACSsVXX

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: The pandemic has broken the supply chain for reproductive-health products. That is putting lives at risk, @annalouiesuss of @FullerProject writes: https://t.co/LWr37i8lkD

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: Hong Kong's police force had dubbed itself "Asia's Finest." Now it is seen by many as an occupying force. There are lessons for American police from the city's experience, writes @TMclaughlin3: https://t.co/urdXoaZZSQ

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @AdamHSays: "This is America. The problems with our response to the pandemic reflect the problems of the country itself."

Read @yayitsrob and @alexismadrigal https://t.co/qC76CxrAHK

name: TheAtlantic
text: On Saturday, the boy band BTS revealed a $1 million donation to Black Lives Matter. @kait_tiffany on how the organizing efforts of K-pop fandoms helped pave the way for these groups to show support: https://t.co/srqnspXKgM

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Romney’s path to yesterday’s Black Lives Matter protest began half a century earlier with his father—a man whose legacy has long shaped, and sometimes haunted, his son," McKay Coppins writes: https://t.co/PkUL50cBuP

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Shirley" is a strange biopic about the 20th-century horror master Shirley Jackson that melds reality and fiction to intoxicating effect, @davidlsims writes of the new movie, now streaming on Hulu. https://t.co/5BcdDRpU0D

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AmyWeissMeyer: "Americans may wish the virus to be gone, but it is not." https://t.co/33K0tI6nJi

name: TheAtlantic
text: As the coronavirus changed cities, it created a "natural experiment" for the urban rat, @sarahzhang reports: https://t.co/C1FXZg0Kvq

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @TheAtlPhoto: Images From a Worldwide Protest Movement - 34 photos from protests that took place around the world over the weekend, in support of ongoing American demonstrations against systemic racism and police brutality. https://t.co/KpYz4IYL4Q https://t.co/UbqcYtaqZ3

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @gcaw: What should we do with all those Confederate monuments and statues?  Why "put them in a museum" is not the answer: https://t.co/6bfNIopuGY (My latest in @TheAtlantic)

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Once the country has an improved idea about what policing is for, then begins the process of developing evidence-informed policies and practices to carry out that vision," @mearest and Tom R. Tyler write: https://t.co/wwlbIMZEbE

name: TheAtlantic
text: Over the weekend, demonstrations took place around the world, with thousands of people outside the United States marching to show solidarity with American protests over the killing of George Floyd by Minneapolis police. Via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/cKUTynmoue

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Ridding ourselves of history is a fantasy—in this case a fantasy of absolution, as if any place could be washed free of its sins by a single act of iconoclasm. But history can be managed in more and less graceful ways," @gcaw writes: https://t.co/V5Wotnke8Q

name: TheAtlantic
text: SPONSORED: Why do some companies choose to take a moral stance while others don’t? New research shows that businesses that choose to follow their principles are more successful over the long term than those that don’t. https://t.co/g77fchyQm1 #KPMGBLC @KPMG_US

name: TheAtlantic
text: The pandemic has broken the supply chain for reproductive-health products. That is putting lives at risk, @annalouiesuss of @FullerProject writes: https://t.co/x0zPyRMgYW
